page.title: 16GRETTON HAND WEAVERS
page.content: Malcolm and Elisabeth Palmer live and work in a large 18th. century cottage in Gretton High Street. They have a very well-equipped workshop containing all the necessary equipment for spinning and weaving. Elisabeth has been weaving for 25 years. Malcolm was a mechanical engineer and this background knowledge proves useful when repairs to spinning wheels and looms are required. Evening and morning classes are run in both subjects catering for all levels of students. Also about 10 day schools are held every year, which include some tuition in dyeing. There is always one outside tutor and one new subject covered. Individual and residential courses are also available providing both basic techniques for beginners and advanced or specialist techniques for the more experienced.
